name: The Ultimate Roasted Veggie Sandwich
description: This healthy vegan roasted vegetable sandwich is packed with grilled veggies, mustard, mayo and sriracha for an extra awesome taste. It’s perfect for a summer picnic or light meatless lunch. Make it in the oven or on the grill. Allergen Information: free of dairy, egg, corn, nut. Can be made soy-free with soy-free mayo. It can be made gluten-free with gluten-free bread.
recipeIngredient: thinly sliced cauliflower (1/4 inch or less)
vegan mayonnaise of choice ( I used Nasoya Light)
bread slices ( or baguette or hoagie roll)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large grill pan on medium-high heat. Drizzle a little oil and spread on the pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large grill pan on medium-high heat. Drizzle a little oil and spread on the pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the sliced veggies on the pan. Cook until well grilled. Flip and grill a bit more. Grill till tender crisp.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the sliced veggies on the pan. Cook until well grilled. Flip and grill a bit more. Grill till tender crisp.

recipeInstructions.text: Broccoli and Cauliflower take longer to get grilled. About 8-10 minutes. I used small Broccoli Florets and sliced them into halfs. Other veggies get done in 6-8 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Broccoli and Cauliflower take longer to get grilled. About 8-10 minutes. I used small Broccoli Florets and sliced them into halfs. Other veggies get done in 6-8 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Grill or toast the bread slices. Spread mayo on both sides of the bread slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Grill or toast the bread slices. Spread mayo on both sides of the bread slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Layer some spinach/greens. Top with red onions, Zucchini, bell pepper. then Broccoli and Cauliflower.
recipeInstructions.name: Layer some spinach/greens. Top with red onions, Zucchini, bell pepper. then Broccoli and Cauliflower.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle salt and pepper. Add mustard and Sriracha or ketchup to taste. Serve hot.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle salt and pepper. Add mustard and Sriracha or ketchup to taste. Serve hot.

recipeInstructions.text: If roasting in the oven, toss veggies in oil, salt and pepper and bake at 425 degrees F until tender crisp. 15-25 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: If roasting in the oven, toss veggies in oil, salt and pepper and bake at 425 degrees F until tender crisp. 15-25 minutes.
